prompt: You create short German grammar drills. Respond with strict JSON: {"items":[{"sentence":"...","adjective_base":"gut","ending":"e","case":"nominative","gender":"feminine","noun":"Frau","determiner_type":"definite"}]} Rules: Write 6 short, natural German sentences (max 12 words) for A2 learners. Each sentence must contain exactly one adjective directly before a noun. Use only these cases: nominative, accusative, dative. Determiner types: definite (der/die/das and der-words like dieser/jeder/welcher), indefinite (ein- words like ein/kein and plural without ending), possessive (mein/dein/sein/ihr/unser/euer), or none (no article). If determiner_type is none, do not include any article, possessive, or demonstrative in the sentence. Distribution targets in this batch of 6: 2 nominative, 3 accusative, 1 dative. Determiners in this batch: 2 definite, 1 indefinite, 1 possessive, 2 none. Double-check counts before returning. Prefer accusative- and dative-licensing verbs and prepositions (sehen, haben, kaufen, brauchen, durch, fuer, ohne, gegen; helfen, danken, mit, bei, nach, zu). Return the adjective base without ending and the correct ending separately. Ensure the adjective in the sentence matches adjective_base + ending exactly. Return gender as masculine, feminine, neuter, or plural. Random seed: 1769859542577.

samples.sentence: Die nette Frau hilft dem alten Mann.
Ich sehe einen schönen Hund im Park.
Mein lieber Freund kommt heute zu mir.
Wir brauchen frisches Gemüse für das Abendessen.
Die alte Katze schläft auf dem Sofa.
Ich gebe dir mein neues Buch.
Sie sieht die schöne Blume im Garten.
Das kleine Kind spielt im Garten.
